meanings.definition: To make something impure or inferior.
meanings.sent1: Mixing the wrong colors bastardises the painting.
meanings.sent2: Using low-quality ingredients bastardises the dish.
meanings.sent3: Adding too much sugar to the recipe bastardises the taste.
meanings.sent4: His lies bastardises the truth like a dark shadow.
meanings.sent5: The storm's fury bastardises the calm of the sea.

meanings.sent2: Power can sometimes bastardises good intentions.

meanings.sent4: Corruption bastardises the foundation of trust.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of evil bastardises the light of goodness.

meanings.sent2: Misquoting someone can bastardises their words.
meanings.sent3: The fake news tries to bastardises the truth.
meanings.sent4: His twisted words bastardises the meaning of the message.
meanings.sent5: The distorted mirror bastardises reflections into illusions.
